caption: The restaurant has a pleasing divide between walkway and dining room. That and the simple decor create a very comforting and home feel. May of these dishes resonated with my childhood food experiences. The 계란말이 and radish wrap were my favorite  dish components.

You must experience Jeong! Chef David is an artist in the kitchen. Every bite has purpose. My family and friends go as often as we can get a table. The tasting is the way to go!  And Jen, the hostess and co-owner, is so amazingly wonderful.

The best dining experience I’ve ever had. Since the pandemic, I have been disappointed time and time again by poor service and/or subpar food at other “fine dining” establishments.  The service at Jeong was some of the best we’ve ever had, our server’s timing of the tasting menu’s courses was precise, and the chef clearly gave careful thought to each individual course, as well as the progression.  When finished, our server asked, “Which was your favorite course?” The answer is all of them.  I cannot praise this restaurant enough. We will be back, and next time we will be getting the wine pairings.

This was one of my favorite meals in a while, and I think it speaks to how Jeong remains one of the best restaurants in Chicago. Every single component of the meal was perfect, and the wine pairing really accentuated the flavors. The pork cheek was probably my favorite. Our servers were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Truly a spectacular meal!
One of the best tasting menus we have ever had the privilege of eating .

Jeong is the best restaurant I’ve eaten in Chicago thus far. Great job at maintaining COVID safety. Amazing take on Korean flavors and traditional dishes. We did the tasting menu and the complexity of flavors was amazing. The chef did an excellent job guiding us through our meal with the flavors he was intending to portray. We can’t wait to come back when a new tasting menu has been made!
Wonderful dining experience. Very nice, attentive, and enthusiastic staff. Some of the best food in West Town. Try the tasting menu!

Jeong is the real deal. Every dish we ordered was a refined mix of comfort and elevated taste. The sake and wine selections were excellent.   Finally, the staff were gracious and efficient. In fact, too efficient. Alas, the progression was too fast for us, we really wished that we could have had a slower pace to our dinner. We wanted more time to savor each dish more fully, the food was that good!
Really good modern take on traditional Korean dishes

Had the tasting menu with wine pairing and added the octopus from the menu. Food was only okay. Wine was good but they didn’t match the two meat courses (the mains) with wines. Huh? Share a glass (and by glass, I mean a drizzle of wine) over the meats? They need to revise that part. There’s also another course with no wine, apparently a pallet cleanser, which was not well explained by the waiter. That’s more understandable. I can get over the food being mediocre (octopus is fried in small chunks on top of a sticky sauce; the flat iron steak is served in another sticky sauce both tasting like they emerged from a bottle from the back of a fridge), but beyond that, our server wasn’t helping the situation. Upon asking about splitting the wine pairing (the tiniest pour you ever did see) over the two meat courses, she said she would top it off if she saw it was needed. Well, that was her cue to do so. But she didn’t, and about 3 min later, we ordered a full glass. That’s just not right. Very expensive meal and lackluster all around. The lotion in the bathroom is nice though. Hah.  Quick summary: There are so many other amazing tasting menus in the area worth the big bucks where the service makes you wanna leave a generous tip. Do yourself a favor and skip this one. I’m surprised Jeong has this many 5 stars.
Fine dining. Had the tasting menu.  It was good. Nice service.

I've been to this restaurant twice now. The second time we went was months later but still the staff and Jennifer remembered us and greeted us with such warmth!  I appreciated that. So from the beginning, they just made us feel HAPPY to be there. There are restaurants that will do fusion and completely change or sometimes destroy the food but here... they really bring out the creativity without losing the depth of that food and how that food was made . It's origin.  I feel like they really kept the tradition and made it more elegant visually and taste wise! Their cocktails are amazing!  My mom is a great korean cook and so I usually get disappointed when I go to a korran restaurant or Korean fusion but this place.... I will recommend to anyone who enjoys and appreciates beautifully made tasty food!

Really great tasting menu. Left feeling satisfied and full, though I could’ve eaten about ten of the last dessert- this amazing pudding dish. Loved the decor too, but was confused by the waitstaff attire- which seemed to be whatever they felt like wearing that night. It took away from the elegance. Would definitely return.

We had dinner at Jeong on 1/4/20. We at least one of everything and two of most. It was a great experience with our group of 6. The service was excellent and the food was wonderful. What do we suggest? Salmon tartar, short ribs .... too much to remember try everything.

I would give Jeong a 4.5 if I could, still some room for improvement, so not quite a 5* yet. We went with the tasting menu and wine pairing and everything was delicious, but was just missing that little extra something that might make it standout come next September. My standouts were the Wagyu with Kimichi truffle emulsion and the sweet potato pudding, which has a really enjoyable salty granola component. The pours were a little short, which made it challenging to get through the two mains since they shared a pairing. Will definitely be back, as it's a great addition to the neighborhood.
Love the service and the food was amazing
All around fantastic! Everything we had on the tasting menu was a hit and the wine pairing was great.
Excellent food and service. We had the tasting menu which was well priced and well timed! Great place for excellent service and good food.

I love that the restaurant offers a very intimate feel.  The staff were very attentive but not intrusive.  My friend and I were able to have a conversation and enjoy our cocktails before dinner without much interruption.  We both opted for the tasting menu w/wine pairings.  I will admit that I was not impressed with the first two dishes, a rice cake, and then the salmon tartar. However, the dishes that followed were terrific.  We thought the price was reasonable. Overall, we were satisfied with the experience, and the portions.  We would go back.
Great installation of an elevated Korean food experience. Each dish was crafted with care, and the service was excellent. Would recommend the halibut dish and mandu.

Interesting high end Korean place. Just slightly fancy. Portion sizes looked tiny on Yelp but the dishes were sufficient for my party to split 3 ways. The short was very good.  The other a la carte dishes were also good. My only complaint is that the beer list was very short ( just four beers ).
One of the best up and coming restaurants in Chicago, easy
Some of the best food I’ve had in my life
Excellent tasting menu and service
Really interesting restaurant. Korean-French fusion elevated. I've never been to a restaurant quite like this before. Worth the trip and the cost.

I read about this modern new restaurant in a lot of different articles and figured it was worth a try! They are known for their tasting menu which is six or seven little bites of food for 87 dollars. I decided to order off the à la cart menu because I didn't want a long drawn out meal.  To start I ordered the riesling wine and my mom had the gin drink. I liked the wine but it needed to be much colder. My moms drink (see picture) was very different than the waiter described and was too spicy for her. I really liked it but it definitely was spicy so beware.  We decided to order two different plates from the à la cart menu because they are known for their salmon tartar and scallop (individually priced at $20 and $16 which was a lot for how small the portions were).. We also ordered the Tteokbokki, Broccoli, Kalbi jjim (short rib), and one of the sashimi entrees. The salmon tartar and the scallop along with the broccoli were the highlights of this meal for me. The waiter RAVED about the Tteokbokki but never brought it to the table which was sad..  My mom loved the short rib but it is a pretty small portion for the price (~30 dollars). I didn't love the sashimi small plate and it was the smallest portion ever for $20.  All in all, I would come back for the tasting menu (which they are know for) and order the  Tteokbokki because I REALLY wanted to try it. I'd skip ordering a la carte because of the portion sizes for the price.  Service was slow but our waiter was nice enough.  For two of us bill came out to $150 excluding tip and we each only had one drink. I did leave hungry which shouldn't be the case for a $150 meal...
Asian Fusion done right! I thoroughly enjoyed  the modern take on classic Korean flavors and preparations!
We had the tasting menu and it was fantastic. The flavors continued to build throughout the tasting. Highly recommended!
Everything we had was excellent.

What an amazing restaurant was delicious food, excellent service and, great attention to detail. I've been to a bunch of restaurants that offer tasty menu and this one is just as good as many that are significantly more expensive in every aspect the quality of food or the service.

An example of a restaurant that has received a lot.of hype but doesn't follow through. Don't get me wrong, the food was good but it certainly wasn't great. The tasting menu had some good dishes (wagu beef) but they plating was nowhere near as elegant as you will see in advertising.  We were disappointed and in a city where good doesn't cut it we wouldn't be back.

Ok here is my honest experience  Warm Inviting dining room Staff was very engaging and pleasant Odered the tasting menu with a couple extra al carte dishes. First dish was tofu with crab. Amazing silky  texture that I wasn't expecting. Wow give me another one what a great opening dish. Scallop was perfectly cooked and and a delicious sauce. Salmon tartare was  beautifully presented and flavors  mixed well together Duck was perfectly cooked but the dish  was awkward for me. Duck, a side of rice and some very flavorful  but strong kimchi I just wanted more Duck. I didnt really need the sides. Wagu dish- Things got a bit off track here. My friend ate here the week before me and raved about it. I took a bite and chewed and chewed maybe 30 times and could barely break it up to swallow.  My dates beef was the same. I should have sent it back but we were having such a good time I didnt want to spoil it. We didnt finish and that should have been a sign for the staff that something was wrong  It was like a tough cheap Siirloin. So the prettiest dish is the Shrimp cake  by far. Amazing sauce and creamy quail eggs. This dish though is not for all. While the sauce is amazing the shrimp cake can be little bland. All in this is a great restuarant with some really good flavor profiles at a reasonable price point. Will definitely go back.

Found this great place through Chicago magazine! Their review held true - they have a short and sweet tasting menu - creative and not overdone at a good price for decent portions. Standout was the Wagyu beef with sunchokes two ways and kimchi sauce, and a salmon sashimi / tartare type morsel! Lots of people, including my fiancé and me, were there celebrating birthdays - and they gave some nice little surprises for that.

Jeong is a wonderful Korean fusion restaurant.  I've had the tasting menu both times.  Wonderful mixture of flavors,  attentive wait staff,  interesting cocktails. Very accommodating for food allergies.
Flavors and execution spot on.  Only wish they would bring back the jjajongmyeon and other hannun dishes.  Also pretty small portions for the entrees.
Great joint to get a fancy Korean joint. Definitely order the dduboki
Delightful delicious food in an elegant setting. Korean flavors taken to new heights.

One of the best meals I've had in Chicago. Impeccable service and a fantastic & intimate space. The tasting menu was worth every penny. The salmon tartare was one of the best bites of food I've ever had, only surpassed by the wagyu beef they served. Get in here while you can because this place is going to be packed for a long time to come.

The seven course meal that I had was exceptional. The first 5 courses reminded me of meals I had in Seoul, Kyoto, or Bejing. But the chefs create  wonderful and different taste pairings, such as having kimchi with duck, or wonderful sauces with  beef, so the the dining experience is unique and unforgettable. And the wine pairings are incredible. You can have saki, pino grigio, Chardonnay, heavy red, and Italian dessert wines with the different courses. And interestingly, the dessert courses are reminiscent of French and German faire. So you can feel like you are eating in different countries, all at the same meal!
Great food. Will go again as soon as possible.

We had to  make reservation a month ahead to get seating. The place is quite small. The food certainly lived up to the hype. The tasting menu was fantastic and was probably their best. The other ala carte dishes ranged from good to great. The cod cooked in a soup of smoked bacon, seaweeds and mussels was outstanding.
The most thoughtfully planned out dining experience.
Absolutely breathtaking. 15/10 would eat everything until forcibly carted away.

Beautiful spot in Noble Square. Be sure to order the kalbi jjim--braised short ribs with confit turnips and brown butter carrot veloute. That dish is off-the-charts good. We loved the odeng--shrimp cake with gochujang aioli, and the cod with wakame, mussels, bacon and miyukguk sauce. Such an amazing meal! Our table shared the chocolate cake and rice hi chew mochi for dessert--both terrific. Yes, it's tricky to score a reservation, but so worth it!
Had the tasting menu with wine pairing and hit after hit! Service is on point and super friendly. Go there! Go now!
Outstanding food AND service!

The food here is pretty good, I would have given it 4 stars for taste alone. But leaving it 3 stars as we ordered the recommended amount from the a la carte menu, and still spent a good amount of money, and left starving. We literally had to get sandwiches on the way home.  I was really excited to take my friend who was visiting as he had just come back from several years abroad in Korea. We wanted to love to Jeong and were disappointed.  I found a few dishes to be overly salty, but that could be me. Some dishes, while pretty, felt like nothing special. I’m uncertain whether or not the chef’s intention was to be authentic, but it is not authentic, for those looking for more authentic modern Korean cuisine. Perhaps the tasting menu had something else to offer that we missed out on.  Finally, there is a gluten free menu. It’s a bit limited but there are options!  Overall, I’m in no rush to go back.

Underwhelmed. Very solid cooking techniques, yet dishes with Korean influence are overly forced and wired as a result. Go and expect a Contemporary American experience, or you will leave dissatisfied.

The space is very welcoming. Staff is attentive and I loved the table setting. Tasting menu is reasonably priced with a good variety. My favorite was the bavette which was accompanied by a mouth watering truffle sauce. Definitely will be back.

The space is very welcoming. Staff is attentive and I loved the table setting. Tasting menu is reasonably priced with a good variety. My favorite was the bavette which was accompanied by a mouth watering truffle sauce. Definitely will be back.

We are relatively new to Chicago and missed out on the Hanbun tasting dinners, but we loved our Hanbun lunches and Dave and Jen gave our son the cooking lesson of his life for his birthday. So we knew we had to try Jeong early before it became impossible to get in! It did not disappoint in one area. We chose the tasting menu with our two older children (12 and 17) and it was impeccable from start to finish. I don't think I could pick a favorite course! The silken tofu was like slipping into the warm comfort of home if your Mom was a five star chef. The salmon tartare was fresh, filled with contrasting textures, nuanced with flavor, and loved by everyone at the table (even one who is iffy on salmon). The scallop and duck and bavette were just perfection. I don't have any other words to describe them! Cooked to perfection and balanced with incredible flavors. And the desserts and cocktails were delicious. We had the Jujube to start which will thrill Old Fashioned lovers. Dave is doing amazing things in this kitchen. And Jen is a perfect hostess in the front of the house. Wines choices and cocktails were excellent. The space is cozy and casual, yet refined. All of the dinnerware and glassware was lovely and became an artistic part of each dish. And almost as important, Dave and Jen exude positivity and humility, are both incredibly warm and kind, and equally talented. Get in soon, before you can't!

Plate after plate of their tasting menu, Jeong has proved to be the finest display of Korean cuisine, or any cuisine, I’ve had in Chicago... beautiful interior and service to boot. Highly recommend!!! 😋
Fabulous dining experience from Dave Park and Jennifer Tran
Tasting menu was a well conceived sequence of distinct dishes.  And it added up to a full meal...2 desserts!
The tasting menu with the wine pairing was excellent. Great atmosphere and ambiance too.

After missing out on Hanbun, I was very pleased to have made it to Jeong. While it is still finding its legs, every dish on the tasting menu had something pleasing or surprising. Combined with a thoughtful cocktail, sake, and wine menu, this is a great entry from Dave Park and Jennifer Tran.

The food is absolutely amazing. I wanted to try the chef's cooking when he was in the suburbs but he was always booked. I'm glad he was finally able to open a full restaurant. Everything was very flavorful, the only disappointment/let down was probably the tteokbokki (rice cake). It wasn't amazing or out of the ordinary, it was just alright. I highly recommend the broccoli and the yukhoe (steak taretare). The duck was definitely better than the short ribs. The odeng was just okay, not great, not bad, felt a bit lacking. I didn't get to try dessert this time, but I will next time, might try the tasting menu. A la carte is the way to go if it's your first time, to get a feel of the flavors.
My new favorite restaurant in Chicago! Had the tasting menu, and it was mind blowingly delicious. Every dish was exceptional.... Definitely going back to try everything on the a la carte menu!

This is an amazing restaurant.  I'm a big Korean food fan, and have been all over the Chicago options, plus a recent trip to Seoul, and this place holds up as both highly authentic, but also elevated cuisine. This isn't fusion food, but more like home style Korean cuisine as prepared by an incredibly talented chef. I hope that this place gets a Michelin star.
Nice

This restaurant is amazing. I've been lucky enough to go twice and have tried several items from the a la carte menu and also the tasting menu. You can't go wrong with either - all of the food is absolutely incredible.On the a la carte menu, you have to try the tteokbokki, the pork and kimchi dumpling, and the short rib. I also could not believe how good the chocolate cake was!!!  On my more recent visit this past weekend, I opted for the tasting menu. All I can say is WOW. I loved every single thing that was served. For me, the highlights of the tasting menu were the salmon tartare and the bavette, but each dish was so incredible it's hard to choose.  The cocktails were also out of this world tasty.  The staff is incredible knowledgeable about the menu and I love that our waitress told us how she recommended eating each of dishes. They were also kind and attentive.  I can't recommend Jeong highly enough!
Modern Korean influenced fare done very well. Beautiful space and warm genuine team .

Beautiful space, super friendly staff, and Jen is just wonderful. We went with the Tasting Menu and each of the 7 courses was delicious. The kimchi truffle sauce was out of this world. The scallop was amazing. The salmon tartare was phenomenal. Every dish was beautifully presented and packed with flavor that was even more delightful than it looked. Can't wait to go back and try the a la carte menu.  See you soon!  Alissa and Michael
Excellent. Great service, wonderful tastes and textures. Very clever dishes... the hi chew mochi dessert is for sure worth a taste!

I’ve been to Jeong three times. Each and every  dish we ordered was original, consistent and phenomenally executed. Chef Dave certainly has a way of expressing his perspective of nostalgic Korean food—I especially love the dessert called “rice”, a playful taste of bright citrus and vanilla with an awesome texture that makes me giddy, and takes me back to the candy of my own childhood too. The wine menu is terrifically thoughtful; I was really happy with the uncommon offerings at surprisingly approachable prices. Cocktails were perfectly balanced and uniquely delicious. The staff is pleasant, helpful, sincere, and charismatic. The decor is contemporary, chic, and warm with cues to Korean inspiration.  À la carte or Tasting Menu, you can’t go wrong.  The sashimi and tteokbokki are delicious and shocking at the same time, I mean whoa!, flavors that I’ve never been exposed to in my life.  What stands out the most to me about Jeong, is their take on crowd pleasers like, braised short ribs (kalbi jjim) and chocolate dessert—they are anything but basic. Each uniquely differentiated from any short rib or cake you’ve ever had. (I have lost sleep thinking about the kalbi jiim, it seriously haunts me.)  Above all, the atmosphere made me feel calm and the food made me really happy.  So excited about what this crew is up to and what they bring to the Chicago food scene!

Did the tasting menu which was delicious; my favorites were the salmon, rice meat kimchi combo, and bavette cut beef. Also did a couple a la charge orders extra: the broccoli and rice pudding desserts were very good. Staff was very nice and knowledgeable. Highly recommend.
My little buddy took his lovely facility here last night for his birthday and OMG, little buddy said it was amazing!!!

Finally got the chance to dine here and it did not disappoint! The only downside of the night was having to choose between the tasting menu and the a la carte menu haha. Decided on the tasting menu and each course was incredible. Already thinking about when I'm going back to try the a la carte menu.
Everything from food to service was awesome. Hard to believe this was their first night open.
Elegant and soulful.
